meanings.definition: The act of making something Latin in character or form.
meanings.sent1: The latinization of the menu at the Italian restaurant made it more authentic.
meanings.sent2: The latinization of the architecture in the city gave it a classical feel.
meanings.sent3: The latinization of the dance moves at the party added a fun twist to the evening.
meanings.sent4: The latinization of the music transformed the atmosphere into a cultural celebration.
meanings.sent5: The latinization of the festival decorations brought a festive and lively vibe to the event.

meanings.definition: The process of adopting Latin influence or style.
meanings.sent1: The latinization of the fashion industry led to a resurgence of classical designs.
meanings.sent2: The latinization of the language brought a touch of elegance to the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The latinization of the party theme made everyone feel like they were in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent4: The latinization of the artwork added a sophisticated flair to the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The latinization of the music playlist set a refined tone for the evening.

meanings.definition: The conversion of words or names into Latin forms.
meanings.sent1: The latinization of the names on the map made it easier to understand the locations.
meanings.sent2: The latinization of the scientific terms helped students grasp the concepts better.
meanings.sent3: The latinization of the street signs gave the neighborhood a scholarly vibe.
meanings.sent4: The latinization of the book titles added a touch of ancient wisdom to the library.
meanings.sent5: The latinization of the historical documents preserved the authenticity of the texts.
